text: they all saying go when life gives you
lemons make lemonade
what you do when life gives you cancer
this is not a sob story this is Steven
story and it was a story that moved and
motivated a nation a teenager diagnosed
with bowel cancer of 15 who decided to
use the last few years of his life to
raise money for other young cancer
victims but Steven said he wanted to put
the fun in fundraising and so he did he
crowd surfed in a rubber dinghy
he went skydiving he played a drum in
front of a vast crowd Wembley and he got
a tattoo a troll complete with the scars
of operations while he was busy
completing his bucket list of things to
do before he died he was raising money I
think one of the things that Steven
always stress Easy's am I have cancer or
cancer doesn't happening his initial
fundraising target was 10,000 pounds but
his campaign attracted celebrity
endorsement and the money kept rolling
in in April he thought in his own words
that he was a goner
and he posted what he thought was his
final picture I don't I can do what I do
the recognition I love nice comments but
I do what I do because I find the best
way to help myself
is to help provisioner I'm proud of the
feeling I get just by ways and all this
money that money has been used by the
Teenage Cancer Trust to provide expert
help and support at specialist units
across the country it's the legacy that
Steven would have been most proud of I
don't mean I want to die but if my
story's Petey's obvious not to take life
for granted then so be it
in the meantime I'll be trying to enjoy
every second as much as possible cancer
sucks
but life is great
